Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameboard

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameboard.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Board extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new Board object with a 9x9 game board.

  • Method Details

    • initBoard

      public void initBoard(int numPlayers)
      Initializes the board depending on the number of players in the game
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - number of players

    • getGameboard

      public Square[][] getGameboard()
      Retrieves the current game board.
      Returns:
      The matrix representing the current state of the game board.

    • refillBoardWithItems

      public void refillBoardWithItems(ArrayList<ItemTile> items)
      Refills the game board with items available in bag.
      Parameters:
      items - available in bag

    • numCellsToRefill

      public int numCellsToRefill()
      Returns the number of empty cells in which thee will be a random ItemTile extracted from the Bag during refill. This is also the number of ItemTiles to extract from Bag
      Returns:
      number of items needed to refill the board

    • needsRefill

      public boolean needsRefill()
      Returns true if board needs to be refilled
      Returns:
      true if board needs refilling

    • placeItem

      public void placeItem(ItemTile i, int row, int column)
      Places an ItemTable on a GameBoard cell
      Parameters:
      i - the IteTile to be added
      row - the row number of the target cell (in which the item will be placed)
      column - the row number of the target cell (in which the item will be placed)

    • pickItem

      public ItemTile pickItem(int row, int column) throws IllegalDrawException
      Returns the ItemTile in the target cell of the board (identified by row and column number)
      Parameters:
      row - the row number of the target cell
      column - the column number of the target cell
      Returns:
      the ItemTile corresponding to the cell specified through row and column parameters
      Throws:
      IllegalDrawException

    • pickItems

      public ArrayList<ItemTile> pickItems(ArrayList<Square> squares) throws IllegalDrawException
      Picks up items from the specified squares on the game board and returns them as an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      squares - An ArrayList of Square objects representing the squares from which to pick up items.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ItemTile objects representing the items picked up from the squares.
      Throws:
      IllegalDrawException

    • enableSquaresWithFreeSide

      public void enableSquaresWithFreeSide()
      Set ItemTiles pickable as First ItemTiles

    • doesSquareHaveFreeSide

      public boolean doesSquareHaveFreeSide(int row, int column)
      Parameters:
      row - row number of the square to check
      column - column number of the square to check
      Returns:
      true if the square has a free side (not containing a real item)

    • getSquare

      public Square getSquare(Coordinates coords)
      Retrieves the square at the specified coordinates on the game board.
      Parameters:
      coords - The coordinates (row, column) of the desired square.
      Returns:
      The Square object at the specified coordinates on the game board.

    • disableAllSquares

      public void disableAllSquares()
      Disables all squares on the game board. This resets the 'pickable' property of each square to false, indicating that they cannot be picked.
